file_content.text: M--my lord! I'm sorry. I'm so sorry. They said they'd kill me. They said they'd kill me if I didn't.
Who said they'd kill you?
Who?
P--P--Paladius's men. They said they'd kill me if I didn't bring you this.
This is very strange.
This is no place for cowards.
You must pay. [Kill him]
Aaagh!
Sith! Did you have to kill him?
Members of this cult will fear me and me alone.
I had to assert my authority.
I suppose it could be a matter of opinion.
I guess not.
Fair enough. Now what's this thing he brought?
Keep your moral squeamishness to yourself.
Don't question me.
Yes, my lord. Now what's this thing he brought?
It looks like a holodevice. Let me see here....
Ah, Sith. Good evening. How good to talk to you again.
I'm sorry to use such an unconventional method to contact you, but I had to be sure you got the message. You understand.
If you're trying to intimidate me, you failed.
I'm not easily scared.
Yes, but I think your followers understood perfectly. The truth is, when you first attacked my cult, I was angry. Frustrated.
A call would have been sufficient.
No, I don't.
No, I like this better--more impact. The truth is, when you first attacked my cult, I was angry, frustrated.
You have my attention. For now.
What's the message?
Wonderful. You see, I've had a bit of a revelation. When you first attacked my cult, I took it very personally.
And then I realized--you're Zash's apprentice! All this trouble is just about some silly artifact.
Let's let bygones be bygones, hm? We can meet at my place, in Network Access. We'll chat, I'll give you the artifact, and all will be mended.
Are you trying to make me laugh?
You're kidding.
I assure you, Sith, I have no sense of humor.
It would be my pleasure to take the artifact off your hands.
Certainly.
I don't like it. And there's no way I'm walking into this guy's house.
I'm not one of your meek little cultists. You lie, you pay.
No tricks or I'll kill you.
I promise--no tricks, or may I die creditless on Tatooine scrubbing a Jedi's back.
Take time to consider my offer. But not too long, or my good mood may sour. And bring your friends.
Lying son of a Hutt! You're not seriously considering it, are you?
Do not listen to the little coward. We will devour this Sith, my master.
You can't expect to go in there without there being some kind of trick!
I'm going, Destris, and you're coming with me.
We must face Paladius.
I've been after that artifact this whole time, and now he's offering to give it to me.
Why not?
You can get yourself killed if you want, but I didn't keep out of Paladius's reach this long just to walk into his grip.
I'm not stupid enough to fall for that trick.
Do you take me for a fool?
No, don't you see? Sure, it's probably a trap, yes, but this is our chance to strike at him!
Fine. But I'm going in with both eyes open.
Sith! Will you look at this place?
Daegin Strell himself couldn't generate this kind of crowd--and neither can Paladius anymore, from the looks of it.
When will that fool show his face?
I'm growing tired of all this.
Soon. If he wants to have any cult left. Real soon. I'm sure of it. I--
Charisma is natural.
I'm guessing the groundquake was a big help--
Aren't you forgetting something?
Bow, fool!
Yes, my lord. I'm sorry. I--
That was Gar-Nok! You defeated Paladius's right-hand man!
You should hear it. They're calling you the Great Dragon after how you did-in Saben. Look what I found outside!
My lord, for getting Saben off our backs and the Krayts off our streets, we humbly present you with this gift.
You should hear it. They're calling you the Great Healer, after your little trick curing the Rot. Look what I found outside!
My lord, for helping to cure our families and neighbors of the Rot, we humbly present you with this gift.
Already the masses bow to me.
Excellent.
Keep your gift and use it to better your lives.
That's not necessary.
Thank you, my lord. You are most generous. Thank you.
I love getting gifts!
Wonderful!
We are honored to serve you, my lord.
Isn't this great? Kill one gang leader and already you got Paladius scared and people lining up with presents.
Isn't this great? Cure one lousy disease and already you got Paladius scared and people lining up with presents.
No time for celebrating, Destris. Paladius isn't resting.
He's called a big meeting at Meridian Hall. If we don't act, he'll rally his cult and stop our whole operation dead.
Sounds like the perfect opportunity to present the virtues of my own cult.
Then we undermine the rally.
With all respect, these are Paladius's most faithful we're talking about.
If Paladius dares to show his face, I'll make quick work of him.
He's a dead man.
He won't. Paladius only ever broadcasts to his cult by holo.
He must be stopped.
This is our chance. You just go in, make a big show and boom!
It's gonna take more than a show, Destris.
We need to show that you have more power in your little finger than Paladius has in his... wait! I've got it!
It's a crazy idea, but what if you showed that you could move the city itself--make a groundquake?
I walk into Paladius's speech and make the very ground shake? I like it.
Like a miracle? I approve.
What on Nar Shaddaa is a groundquake?
Groundquake?
You know, when the ground shakes underneath you. They're pretty rare, so it'd be a big deal.
How would I even do that?
I can't make a groundquake.
It is a long shot, but it might be the only shot we got.
What've you been putting in your soup, Rylee? Nobody can just make this moon shake!
Stick with me here--you know the gas pipes that run under Meridian Hall? Well, what if we blow up those pipes?
Ooooh! You got brains, girl.
I know just the guy to set it up. Gord Madel, in the Nar Shaddaa Works Administration, takes bribes on the side.
He'll rig you something up, no problem.
Where do I find this scumbag?
Point the way.
Your life depends on this, Destris.
This had better work.
I can't wait to see the look on Paladius's face.
This is going to be fun.
Gord works at the NSWA office in the Duros Sector, not far from Meridian Hall where Paladius is holding his big broadcast.
You just tell him ol' Destris sent you.
There was a lady Sith a while back, Darth Zash. Said she'd send someone to help us out. You it?
Paladius has something I need--and if helping you will get it for me, then yes.
In a manner of speaking.
I'm not going to help you; you're going to help me.
I came for myself.
Of course that's what he meant, my lord.
Yeah, sure, either way. So long as Paladius is made to swallow dirt.
Taking down oppressive cult leaders is a favorite hobby of mine.
It would be a pleasure.
Good! Because it makes me sick to think Paladius is out there while I'm cooped up in this rat hole.
Paladius built his empire on the backs of the poor. Said he'd save them from their miserable lives.
Said we'd make a--what's it--a mighty sword and strike against our enemies. It was all lies.
It was all lies. But you win the support of the poor, you knock Paladius's legs out from under him.
The masses will worship me by dawn.
Wonderful.
Get 'em the way Paladius did--find the biggest, most vicious gang on the block and crush them.
Helping isn't my thing.
My lord, it's not a waste--the impoverished of Nar Shaddaa aren't powerful, but they are numerous. Paladius needs them.
How do I win the love of these poor, downtrodden souls?
Any suggestions?
What Paladius did was find the biggest, most vicious gang on the block and crush them.
Right now, that gang's the Krayts, named after the krayt dragon on Tatooine. Their leader Saben thinks he's descended from one.
Take out Saben, and the masses will see you as a regular hero.
He'll need to be a dragon, if he hopes to stand against me.
He'd better be tough.
With all respect, taking out the Krayts wins you followers only until the next gang rises up. But there may be another way.
Why should I be content to emulate Paladius?
That's beneath me.
You're right, my lord. There are cleverer ways to steal Paladius's power.
And when another gang rises to take the Krayts' place?
Is that really a solution?
You're right. Taking out the Krayts wins you followers only until the next gang rises up. But there may be another way.
A plague called "the Rot" afflicts the poorest of Nar Shaddaa's poor.
But it can be cured, and the person who does so will be regarded not just as a hero, but as a prophet.
I think I'll stick with what I know best--murder and mayhem.
I'd rather fight the gang.
"Prophet." Now that's more to my taste.
I like the sound of that.
I'm glad you approve, my lord.
Tell me how.
The cure to the Rot is owned by Tydis Neutronics. You'll have to steal it from their warehouse, then distribute it.
Then I guess I'll be fighting the Krayts.
Gang-busting is more my style.
I think I'll stick with the killing.
I'd rather murder people.
The direct approach. I like it.
The Krayts' lair is in the Corellian Sector. Crush their leader, and the masses will take notice.
In this case, I'd rather be loved than feared.
I'll do it then.
Good, but be careful.
The warehouse is heavily guarded, but if you can steal the cure and distribute it in the Corellian Sector, you'll own the lower classes.
What have we here? The cavalry looks like. Appreciate the help, but I had it under control.
Show my master some respect, weakling, or I would be all too happy to consume you.
Easy, Destris. This isn't some holo you're talking to.
My lord....
You would be wise to follow her lead.
She's right to bow, Destris.
'Course, my lord. Sorry.
I'm not a king, Rylee.
Bowing's unnecessary.
You are most kind, my lord.
You are indeed beautiful and intelligent.
Paladius was right about you.
Not as much as you are handsome and wise, my lord.
You are the smart one.
Paladius was right about you.
Thank you, my lord.
Oh, Destris, dear brutish Destris. And Rylee--so beautiful and intelligent! You were like children to me, which is why it pains me to do this.
You can cut the act, Paladius. You never cared about any of your "children."
We don't need a tyrant for a father.
Ha. Well said. Marvelous last words. Truly, I expected nothing less, which is what makes this so hard.
Now, if you'll excuse me. My other children would like to play with you.
The cure to the Rot is owned by a company called Tydis Neutronics in the Upper Industrial Sector.
